channel.title: Client Help on 317 server
channel.description:
When I try to (run) run it says "Press any key to continue" Then Nothing else pops up.. This is my first time creating a server, and I been going along pretty good and port forwarding was not a problem.
When I try to run compile it says this [URL=http://swiftkit.net][IMG]http://img713.imageshack.us/img713/6386/y8d.png[/img][/URL] Yes, I have java.
Thanks for the help.. - Yuk

item.title: Client Help on 317 server
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

Null Amount:

Ok, then what’s the problem?

Is it suppose to pop up and say that api error? Why when I try (run) run it just opens and ask me to press a key then closes and nothing else happens? Btw Thank you for being patience and helping me…

Read full topic

Post the code in your compiler/run (whatever you’re having problems with).

item.title: Client Help on 317 server
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:6, topic:524178”][quote author=yuk link=topic=642719.msg4328169#msg4328169 date=1373308607]

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin for me.

You’re supposed to be able to follow that path.

‘‘Click any to continue…’’ - is normal which will come after completed compiling.

So how do I follow that path with the compiled.

Right click > Edit
Change the forward slashes to backslashes. Also, make sure it’s using the correct jdk version that is installed on your computer.

That did not help me, How do I get it to realise that I have java…
[/quote]
It’s not going to recognize that you have Java installed unless you give it the correct path, which was what I corrected you on.[/quote]

Okay thank you and in black slashes, you mean \ right? And it still wont open up the server… How come? Says it doesn’t realise java still.

**Edit so I lead it to java and this is what it says now. Why? So confused

Read full topic

item.title: Client Help on 317 server
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[quote=“yuk, post:5, topic:524178”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=642719.msg4328160#msg4328160 date=1373306759]

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin for me.

You’re supposed to be able to follow that path.

‘‘Click any to continue…’’ - is normal which will come after completed compiling.

So how do I follow that path with the compiled.

Right click > Edit
Change the forward slashes to backslashes. Also, make sure it’s using the correct jdk version that is installed on your computer.
[/quote]
That did not help me, How do I get it to realise that I have java…[/quote]
It’s not going to recognize that you have Java installed unless you give it the correct path, which was what I corrected you on.

Read full topic
